subject: Physics
title: The Rocket Equation
description: Explore Tsiolkovsky’s Rocket Equation and its importance in spaceflight.

content.text: The rocket equation relates velocity change to exhaust velocity and mass ratio.

content.heading: Tsiolkovsky Rocket Equation
content.text: Δv = ve × ln(m0 / mf), where ve is exhaust velocity, m0 is initial mass, and mf is final mass.

content.heading: Velocity Change Example
content.problem: If ve = 2500 m/s, m0 = 5000 kg, mf = 2000 kg, find Δv.

content.heading: Your Turn

If m0 = 5000 and mf = 2500 with ve = 3000, find Δv.

If m0/mf = 3 and ve = 3000, find Δv.
If ve = 2000 and Δv = 2773, find m0/mf ratio.
If Δv = 1000 and ve = 2500, find m0/mf ratio.
If m0/mf = 2 and ve = 2000, find Δv.
If Δv = 1500 and ve = 2500, find m0/mf ratio.
